info.name: IniSevAPI
info.description:
#### See Examples included for `responses` returned in different cases. First, `Open` saved response examples below each `Request`, then use `Preview` Tab for HTML responses while use `Pretty` Tab to view JSON responses.

#### `php artisan queue:work --queue=default,emails database`

###### Artisan Command: `php artisan queue:work --queue=default,emails database` is running continuously to monitor and process `default` and `emails` queues. Otherwise whenever you run this command, the `default` and `emails` queues will start processing. We need `default` queue for `http://localhost:1920/api/v1/email/sendmail/test` GET Request to send test emails.

###### We are using `https://MailTrap.io` free service for emails functionality, because GMail & Hotmail were terminating SMTP connection after TLS handshakes by sending `CRLs (certificate revocation lists)`.

###### Artisan Command: `php artisan serve --port=1920` is being used to run the server on `http://localhost:1920` or `http://127.0.0.1:1920`. Feel free to customize the `--port=1920` to `--port=####` where `####` is the port number of your choice, but do update all `Postman` requests with new port as well.

## IniSevAPI Basic Features
The IniSevAPI is a small API which provides two basic features for Users:
###### 1. to Subscribe to websites for updates about new posts to the subscribed website.

###### 2. to add a post to a particular website for which user has an Author role.

### Steps for using the API

#### Steps to Subscribe:
###### 1. Use the 'Fetch All Websites' GET Request to get a list of all available websites and copy a website's `site_url` for which you want to subscribe.

###### 2. Use the Get User method with an `email` if you don't want to Create a New User and want to use an existing User to Subscribe.

###### 3. Pass the copied `site_url` & your valid email address to the 'Subscribe' GET Request as GET Request Parameter/Variables. Note that both site_url/website and your email must be valid, active and the website must be live in order to successfully add the Website if the website doesn't already exists in the list of all available websites and add a new User if it doesn't already exist in the system already. And at last you will be subscribed to the Website with the Email you passed via Subscribe request, even if the Website & Email weren't already in the system. Email verifications are currently disabled for simplicity.

###### Note: just add `http://` before `site_url` for Website you copied earlier. Otherwise the validation will keep failing.

request.description:
###### Demonstrates Validation Rules for `Website URLs` and `Email addresses`.

#### Before you can Subscribe consider:
###### To Create a Post, you can use one of the emails (salman@inisev.com, salman@sellcodes.com, valentin@sellcodes.com) and websites (`sellcodes.com`, `inisev.com`, `medium.com`, `independent.co.uk`) that already exist in the system for testing. Otherwise, you can use `Subscribe` method to subscribe to a website, if you're having trouble Creating a Post, before you can Create a Post. You can become Author & Subscriber by using `Subscribe` method and creating new `User` with your Valid and Active `Email` address where you can receive emails and can add a New `Website` (using a Live Actual Website URL for example: `https://twitter.com`, `https://facebook.com`, `https://google.com`, `https://blogger.com`, `https://medium.com` or any other Real Website that exists on the internet today) as Website URL `validation rules` uses `active_url` validator.

### Steps for Subscription

###### 1. Use the 'Fetch All Websites' GET Request to get a list of all available websites and copy a website's `site_url` for which you want to subscribe.

###### 2. Use the Get User method with an `email` if you don't want to Create a New User and want to use an existing User to Subscribe.

###### 3. Pass the copied `site_url` & your valid email address to the 'Subscribe' GET Request as GET Request Parameter/Variables. Note that both site_url/website and your email must be valid, active and the website must be live in order to successfully add the Website if the website doesn't already exists in the list of all available websites and add a new User if it doesn't already exist in the system already. And at last you will be subscribed to the Website with the Email you passed via Subscribe request, even if the Website & Email weren't already in the system. Email verifications are currently disabled for simplicity.

###### Note: just add `http://` before `site_url` for Website you copied earlier. Otherwise the validation will keep failing.

request.description:
#### Create New Post for a Particular Website.

###### Provide a Valid Email & Website URL with Post Title (varchar (255)), Post Summary (varchar (500)) & Post Detail (longText).

#### `php artisan queue:work --queue=default,emails database`

###### Artisan Command: `php artisan queue:work --queue=default,emails database` is running continuously to monitor and process `default` and `emails` queues. Otherwise whenever you run this command, the `default` and `emails` queues will start processing. We need `default` queue for `http://localhost:1920/api/v1/email/sendmail/test` GET Request to send test emails.

###### We are using `https://MailTrap.io` free service for emails functionality, because GMail & Hotmail were terminating SMTP connection after TLS handshakes by sending `CRLs (certificate revocation lists)`.

###### Demonstrates Validation Rules for `Website URLs` and `Email addresses` as well as `required` check for `title`, `summary` & `post detail`.

###### Note: just add `http://` prefix in `website` field for Website. Otherwise the validation will keep failing.

#### See Examples included for `responses` returned in different cases. First, `Open` saved response examples below each `Request`, then use `Preview` Tab for HTML responses while use `Pretty` Tab to view JSON responses.

#### Before you can Post consider:
###### To Create a Post, you can use one of the emails (salman@inisev.com, salman@sellcodes.com, valentin@sellcodes.com) and websites (`sellcodes.com`, `inisev.com`, `medium.com`, `independent.co.uk`) that already exist in the system for testing. Otherwise, you can use `Subscribe` method to subscribe to a website, if you're having trouble Creating a Post, before you can Post to it. Or you can become Author & Subscriber by using `Subscribe` method and creating new `User` with your Valid and Active `Email` address where you can receive emails and can add a New `Website` (using a Live Actual Website URL for example: `https://twitter.com`, `https://facebook.com`, `https://google.com`, `https://blogger.com`, `https://medium.com` or any other Real Website that exists on the internet today) as Website URL `validation rules` uses `active_url` validator.
